description.example: The standard plan for the MyPetParlor App
The standard plan for the MyPetParlor App

unitAmount.description: The amount (in cents). Required unless unit_amount_decimal is provided.

unitAmountDecimal.description:
The amount (in decimals) allows up to 9 decimal places. Only supported when add_on_type = usage.
If unit_amount_decimal is provided, unit_amount cannot be provided.

currencies.description: Represents the percentage tier's currencies for the plan.

endingAmount.description:
The ending amount (in cents) for the tier. Allows up to 2 decimal places. Must be left empty if
it is the final tier.

usagePercentage.description:
The percentage taken of the monetary amount of usage tracked. This can be up to 4 decimal places
represented as a float.

endingQuantity.description:
Ending quantity for the tier. This represents a unit amount for unit-priced add ons.
Must be left empty (set at 0) if it is the final tier.

unitAmount.description: The amount (in cents). Required unless unit_amount_decimal is provided.

unitAmountDecimal.description:
The amount (in decimals) allows up to 9 decimal places. Only supported when add_on_type = usage.
If unit_amount_decimal is provided, unit_amount cannot be provided.

setupFee.description:
Amount (in cents) of one-time setup fee automatically charged at the beginning of a subscription billing cycle.
For subscription plans with a trial, the setup fee will be charged at the time of signup. Setup fees
do not increase with the quantity of a subscription plan.

unitAmount.description: The amount (in cents) should not be sent when the pricing model is 'ramp'.

currencies.description: Represents the price for the ramp interval.

startingBillingCycle.description: Represents the billing cycle where a ramp interval starts.

unitAmount.description: The amount (in cents) should not be sent when the pricing model is 'ramp'.
